intro: Campylospermum strictum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Campylospermum strictum is adapted to drought conditions and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant.
